metadata.title: CVE-2021-33582 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Cyrus IMAP before 3.4.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (multiple-minute daemon hang) via input that is mishandled duringhash-table interaction. Because there are many insertions into a singlebucket, strcmp becomes slow. This is fixed in 3.4.2, 3.2.8, and 3.0.16.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33582` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-caldav - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-clients - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-common - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-imapd - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-murder - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-nntpd - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-pop3d - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
cyrus-replication - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.13-5ubuntu0.1~esm1').
